answer:
In BC, there is not a mandatory immunization program nor provincial vaccine exemption form for school aged children. If you choose not to vaccinate your child, or to delay vaccines, it is important that you know how to protect your child, your family and others. Learn more here.
It is strongly advised that children get all of the recommended vaccines and that they get them on time. Please discuss your concerns with your child's doctor or public health nurse.  FInd your local health unit here.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## In BC, there is not a mandatory immunization program nor provincial vaccine exemption form for school aged children.


## If you choose not to vaccinate your child, or to delay vaccines, it is important that you know how to protect your child, your family and others.

Learn more here.
It is strongly advised that children get all of the recommended vaccines and that they get them on time.
Please discuss your concerns with your child's doctor or public health nurse.
FInd your local health unit here.

## Immunization Nurse
question: Hi, I couldn't find any link to Vaccine Exemption Form for school-going children? Could you please put them up on your website or provide me a link to download with info?
